Eric Schmidt is also keeping for himself the outside-facing parts of CEO-dom, which Silicon Vally nerds by their nature are pretty bad at. He has a clumsy way of putting it, but when he talks about the deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership that are increasingly important given Google's global reach, he basically means the large part of the CEO job which involves schmoozing various people in Google's interest. . The news of the change rocked Silicon Valley, with analysts and company insiders offering varying theories. Some said Mr. Eric Schmidt was tired of the day-to-day hassles of management.
